Topic.Title: If you want to know facts about Woodward Google 'Exclusive: Woodward speaks out on White House threat'

Message.Msg: it can't be construed as a threat because in the context it is a harmless statement, and in no way a threat. It's an opinion. Opinions are allowed..The ongoing problem the right has seems to be with English meanings. When a parent says to a child, 'you'l regret that decision" is that also a threat? Of course not. In fact a good friend could tell someone "you'll regret that" and it isn't a threat. In fact the statement to woodward appeared to be much in that light, advice. More important is why the need to find fault endlessly with the President, and why that won't stop, even after an election in his favor. Divide and hate days are over.

Topic.Title: To Debunk The Hawcreek Team Even Further...

Message.Msg: Even if woodward was threatened which he wasn't, threatened isn't an exact word. The meaning ranges from harmless to violent. They prey on those kind of words. They imply violence. Their constant innuendo is Obama is going to put woodward in cement and throw him in a river. Constantly the rwnj distort the truth, and change the meanings of words, with the oblect the degradation of Pres Obama. Constantly they are at it. The people are REALLY getting sick of it too. NOoope not likely. That leaves room for another interpretation, and the more likely, someone expressed his opinion that a mistake had been made. Tooooo bad the conservaturds can only thing emotionally.
